page.title: 09Railways,Rivers and Buses.
page.content: A railway passes through our grid. There is a station at Radyr.32 trains pass through each day on average running to Treherbert,Barry & Merthyr from Cardiff Queen Street Station.One train a week goes to Bristol.Passenger and goods trains use the line.Coke & coal are the main goods transported. The Glamorganshire Canal, now a nature reserve,once carried coal from the valleys to Cardiff Docks where it was exported world-wide.It was widely used in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries.The River Taff which starts in the Brecon Beacons runs into the sea in Cardiff.An hourly bus service runs in Radyr.Bus services are more frequent in Whitchurch as the valley services pass through the village. Every 10-11 year old child in Radyr owned a bicycle.The BMX is very popular in 1985.
